update.description:
![filesave_schematic.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3904031974-filesave_schematic.png)

This pull request implements the file save behavior and GUI changes depicted in the above schematic (courtesy of Louise). It also provide a fix for issue 396: the building editor creates a folder with model.config and model.sdf files for a saved model, adds it to the model path, and notifies the InsertModelWidget to make the model is available in the "Insert Model" tab.

Disclaimer: There are a few known issues that I am leaving for future work:

1. On some computers, saving a model to the home folder causes Gazebo to crash. This happens if the hidden folder ~/.dbus is owned by root. If instructed to write to the home folder, the program will first attempt to write to .dbus, which will lead to a permission denied exception. This could be fixed by adding a try/catch block around the write, but this still does not allow the user to write models to the home folder. Suggestions for a complete fix are welcome.

2. I believe the changes to FinishBuildingDialog should get merged into gui::SaveDialog and SaveDialog should be used in BuildingMaker. I am leaving this for a different pull request until after I have taken a closer look at SaveDialog.
update.title: Building Editor: Improved saving, pop-up flow, and palette buttons

pull_request.title: Building Editor: Improved saving, pop-up flow, and palette buttons

pullrequest.title: Building Editor: Improved saving, pop-up flow, and palette buttons

content.raw:
Do you mean how should they be *visually* treated, specifically? I'm inclined to significantly grey out anything that's in the 3D View that is not the model being built.

Right now, if you have something in the scene when you enter the editor, it's very common for your building to be drawn right on top of it. I'm tempted to completely hide these models because it looks really strange to draw over things (the user can't control where to start drawing in 3D), and not be able to move them out of the way. I'm not sure what's best though.
content.html:
Do you mean how should they be visually treated, specifically? I'm inclined to significantly grey out anything that's in the 3D View that is not the model being built.

Right now, if you have something in the scene when you enter the editor, it's very common for your building to be drawn right on top of it. I'm tempted to completely hide these models because it looks really strange to draw over things (the user can't control where to start drawing in 3D), and not be able to move them out of the way. I'm not sure what's best though.

pull_request.title: Building Editor: Improved saving, pop-up flow, and palette buttons

pullrequest.title: Building Editor: Improved saving, pop-up flow, and palette buttons

content.html:
@spaepcke can probably answer this better than me. I would say that:

  • Buildings made in a previous session are treated like any other model inserted in the scene before opening the editor (since we don't support editing an existing building yet)

  • I think for now we're just leaving the other models there where they were, even if they're on the way... On the Model Editor we're thinking of greying them out, so it is clear they are not part of whatever is being edited.

pull_request.title: Building Editor: Improved saving, pop-up flow, and palette buttons

pullrequest.title: Building Editor: Improved saving, pop-up flow, and palette buttons

content.raw: I'll take a look at these bugs (building_template_model should not be showing up)... just to clarify, how should the building editor treat models that exist in the main window that are outside of the building being edited? How should it treat buildings that were made in a previous session?
content.html: I'll take a look at these bugs (building_template_model should not be showing up)... just to clarify, how should the building editor treat models that exist in the main window that are outside of the building being edited? How should it treat buildings that were made in a previous session?

pull_request.title: Building Editor: Improved saving, pop-up flow, and palette buttons

pullrequest.title: Building Editor: Improved saving, pop-up flow, and palette buttons

content.raw:
I tried this:

1. Draw some walls, `Exit -> Don't Save, Exit` - the building shows on the scene as `building_template_model`

2. Enter building editor, draw some other walls, again `Exit -> Don't Save, Exit` - the new building doesn't show on the World tree

3. Delete `building_template_model` - all buildings disappear

4. Again, enter building editor, draw some walls and  `Exit -> Don't Save, Exit` - the building appears and disappears (I think this is issue #390)

Another one:

Draw some walls, `Exit -> Save and Exit -> Save` - the building shows on the scene, and a `BuildingDefaultName` shows on the World tree, but clicking on the building doesn't highlight the name and vice-versa. Plus, walls can be manipulated individually (these issues don't happen for `Exit -> Don't Save, Exit`).
content.html:
I tried this:

  1. Draw some walls, Exit -> Don't Save, Exit - the building shows on the scene as building_template_model

  2. Enter building editor, draw some other walls, again Exit -> Don't Save, Exit - the new building doesn't show on the World tree

  3. Delete building_template_model - all buildings disappear

  4. Again, enter building editor, draw some walls and Exit -> Don't Save, Exit - the building appears and disappears (I think this is issue #390)

Another one:

Draw some walls, Exit -> Save and Exit -> Save - the building shows on the scene, and a BuildingDefaultName shows on the World tree, but clicking on the building doesn't highlight the name and vice-versa. Plus, walls can be manipulated individually (these issues don't happen for Exit -> Don't Save, Exit).

update.description:
![filesave_schematic.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3904031974-filesave_schematic.png)

This pull request implements the file save behavior and GUI changes depicted in the above schematic (courtesy of Louise). It also provide a fix for issue 396: the building editor creates a folder with model.config and model.sdf files for a saved model, adds it to the model path, and notifies the InsertModelWidget to make the model is available in the "Insert Model" tab.

Disclaimer: There are a few known issues that I am leaving for future work:

1. On some computers, saving a model to the home folder causes Gazebo to crash. This happens if the hidden folder ~/.dbus is owned by root. If instructed to write to the home folder, the program will first attempt to write to .dbus, which will lead to a permission denied exception. This could be fixed by adding a try/catch block around the write, but this still does not allow the user to write models to the home folder. Suggestions for a complete fix are welcome.

2. I believe the changes to FinishBuildingDialog should get merged into gui::SaveDialog and SaveDialog should be used in BuildingMaker. I am leaving this for a different pull request until after I have taken a closer look at SaveDialog.
update.title: Building Editor: Improved saving, pop-up flow, and palette buttons
